channel.title: My packets are gay. :(
channel.description:
This is partly client sided due to me getting the errors on the client, but the server is what is sending the wrong frame or something. I honestly don't know but I do know that this wasn't happening before i added some code. The code i added shouldent of effected anything though as i removed it and it was the same... :/ imsuperman05 and I can't seem to figure it out. [code]Error: Error packet size mismatch in getplayer pos:71 psize:129 Error: T2 - 81,208,65 - 129,3093,3495 - 1,39,-1,89,1,-44,9,0,1,0,0,-24,51,0,0,0, -54,0,-1,-1,40,30,40,29,0,19,-21,6,103,6,-95,0,6,55,0,1,33,1,42,1,10,0,0,0,0,0,3 ,40,3,55,[/code]
EDIT: Added my error... Thanks The Wanderer! XD

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

You should keep backups of your code. My advice is download the base you used, and replace the files that you edited before the error with the old files. Then recode what you added BUT KEEP BACKUPS.

Read full topic

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Well… I can’t find it. I wish I could find the server side of this and change the packet it is sending… Darn. The code that I believed caused this was in PlayerSave.java. Maybe the character rendering is messed up, but I can’t find the cause…

Read full topic

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

Not sure. Open up you client class, client sided, and search 123. Then look for something is referencing packets and/or stream class.

Read full topic

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Well i got the packet 81 to work… what about 123 you provided me with 121 121 and 126…

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

From that pastebin…

if(pktType == 81) { updatePlayers(pktSize, inStream); aBoolean1080 = false; pktType = -1; return true; }
You changed something about how the player renders.

Read full topic

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Ok so my T1 Error packet is 123 and my T2 Error packet is 81. I looked on the first link you provided and they don’t list either of them… Where can I go from here?

Read full topic

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

No… that code is already in your client. It is so you can parse incoming packets.

item.title: My packets are gay. :(
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

You changed something about the player, and it is having difficulty rendering it. Here’s a list of packets for you to reference. T2 is reading I believe.
http://rswiki.gyrat.in/index.php?title=317_Protocol#Server_-.3E_Client_Packets

Parsing packets in client…
http://pastebin.com/JyzG1cLi
